So that is what happened.

I had wandered off to do a little field work and when I came back I 
could not find my way back into the site.  It is going to take 
forever to get caught up on the posts(sigh).  However, I have found 
the time to post a few screen captures from the NHK drama at the 'Spy 
Division'.  And yes, they are a little Saito-centric....but it think 
that will please several of the members.

Did anyone else order a copy of Hillsborough's new book?  Has anyone 
else had their shipment delayed? Again!  And here I thought it would 
be waiting for me upon my return to civilization.  @#$^%!

**stalks off to corner in disgust**

--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, spiritus saitou <spiritus_saitou@y...> 
wrote:
> Unfortunately, EZ-Board got hacked into and major damage done.  
*All* of the messageboards supported there were damaged, some 
completely unrecoverable.  Secretary may have more up to date 
information about what they were doing to restore boards, but I think 
they've done all they could with back-ups that weren't damaged.  In 
trying to better safeguard the system and repair it, I think they did 
some additional damage, too.
>  
> Cool idea with the reviews.  Best place to send them is to this 
list, SHQ.  The Spy Division is more for member and other fan fiction 
and art.  ^_^
>  
> phil
> 
> niwashi_1 <labaker@s...> wrote:
> I found the Shinsengumi Headquarters message board
> http://p076.ezboard.com/bshinsengumiheadquarters
> not too long ago - just long enough to see that it had a bunch of 
> interesting stuff posted there.  Unfortunately, before I had time 
to 
> go through and read all that interesting stuff, it started 
> disappearing.  At first it was just some of the posts missing, then 
> all of the posts and many of the forums disappeared.
> 
> What's going on???  And is it going to get fixed?
> 
> 
> On a marginally related note, I recently bought the first volume of 
> each of several different Shinsengumi manga.  I was thinking of 
> writing up a little first-impression mini-review of each of them 
and 
> posting it on the messageboard (if it were still there).  I guess 
I'll 
> post to the Yahoo group instead (although I generally like message 
> boards better than e-mail lists).  Is the SHQ group or the 
> SHQ_Spy_Division group the better one to send reviews to?
> 
> 
> Niwashi
>
